title: After the controversial reign of John Bercow, the next Commons Speaker will have to be different
text:
John Bercow will step down as Speaker of the House of Commons in just a few days, and once again he is embroiled in controversy over his impartiality. The authority and effectiveness of the Speaker depend upon people being able to trust him.

I had plenty of frustrations with his predecessors, but, as colleagues will attest, it was not in my character to criticise a Speaker’s ruling, even in private, let alone on the floor of the House of Commons, before this week. It is as important to appear impartial as to be impartial, and in his ruling on Monday on the meaningful vote he failed.
